channel.title: Bouncing Applet help please :(
channel.description: I've ditched my color clicker bot I've been working or for a month now and decided to make a completely new one through the use of Bytecode Injection using the BCEL Library. sL helped me with some basic shit for the GUI and getting the client applet in the JFrame etc.. One problem... THE FUCKING APPLET WON'T STOP BOUNCING! It's sooo annoying. So, if any of you are kind enough, help please.

item.title: Bouncing Applet help please :(
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

psb, please do not be an irrelevant fuckwit, thanks.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz

@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

Shared memory is easier if you’re not a moron… The key word in this is “not”.

Read full topic

item.title: Bouncing Applet help please :(
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

[quote=“Iamadam, post:27, topic:133741”][quote author=1337h4x link=topic=185001.msg1677744#msg1677744 date=1187232795]
Ditch the JTabbedPane. For some reason the applet doesn’t like it. Or you could be like Ollie and ditch the whole fancy gui xD
[/quote]
Or you could put it in a JTabbedPane, and fix it properly
Amazingly, there is actually a reason the Applet bounces. You can easily fix it by overriding setLocation() in the java.awt.Canvas subclass, within the client.[/quote]

You act as if I know Java…

Yerr jk.
Thanks Iamadam.

Read full topic

item.title: Bouncing Applet help please :(
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

1337h4x:

Ditch the JTabbedPane. For some reason the applet doesn’t like it. Or you could be like Ollie and ditch the whole fancy gui xD

Or you could put it in a JTabbedPane, and fix it properly
Amazingly, there is actually a reason the Applet bounces. You can easily fix it by overriding setLocation() in the java.awt.Canvas subclass, within the client.

Read full topic

[/quote]
Yarr, try to catch the bouncing applet[/quote]

lolllllllllllllllllllllllllllllllll.

Hmm…
well to fix it I made a main UI with a “start bot” button, and once clicked, it starts a bot in a new private window.
Then proceeds with executing what I wanted it to do.
I would just hurry up and hack the focus listener so that I could dispatch events with it being minimized but I’m a lazy person at best.

item.title: Bouncing Applet help please :(
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

thnx, didn’t know that :). But still using multiple jvms is easier. If one bot conflicts and the jvm quits, other bots won’t be affected.

Read full topic

item.title: Bouncing Applet help please :(
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“qauters, post:16, topic:133741”]I had it bouncing aswell, it’s the JTabbedPane, I got rid of it when creating a frame for itself.
Btw, if you create multiple java applets in the same jvm, you’ll get out of memory when you try more then 5 bots.
So give each rs applet it’s own jvm and connect it with the gui using sockets.
Atleas that’s how I do it :|[/quote]-Xmx1G

or whatever amount you want

Read full topic

item.title: Bouncing Applet help please :(
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

I had it bouncing aswell, it’s the JTabbedPane, I got rid of it when creating a frame for itself.
Btw, if you create multiple java applets in the same jvm, you’ll get out of memory when you try more then 5 bots.
So give each rs applet it’s own jvm and connect it with the gui using sockets.
Atleas that’s how I do it

Read full topic

item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

frank_:

I am assuming that adding the applet to a jpanel then addint that jpanel to the jframe stops it bouncing? :\

Ok, I got it to stop bouncing only if you don’t fuck with the sizing.
So, I think I’m good.

Urghh…
Maybe it’s since I’m using a BorderLayout ?

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Its possible it has something to do with the JTabbedPane, I would try simply adding the JPanel that holds the client directly to the JFrame avoiding the tabs to see if it then bounces or not, let us know.

Read full topic

item.title: Bouncing Applet help please :(
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

frank_:

you use a JFrame, he claims to be using a Frame; thats one key difference

Oh shit thanks, forgot to type the J before the Frame.

All I have is a JMenuBar and a JMenu, JMenuItem, JTabbedPane, JPanel(which holds the client, then the tabbed pane’s tab 1 holds this panel), and thats all I believe.

Read full topic
